Exception creating editor: Unable to instantiate editor: org.eclipse.jdt.ui.
CompilationUnitEditor org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: Plug-in org.
eclipse.jdt.ui was unable to load class org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.javaeditor.
CompilationUnitEditor.

Is this preventing you from starting? Does it always happen? Could you cause it
to happen and send log entries that are generated for that session?

Also, you may want to use 3.0M8, where a lot of issues related to logging were
fixed.

Is there more information on this?  Does it happen with a 1.4.2 VM?  M8?  What 
linux distro, what version?

The M8 build is proving to be stable so far.  The version of linux I was using
on the M7 build which caused the error was Fedora FC2 test 1. It may be safe to
close this because I haven't been able to reproduce it with the current M8
build.  You can also close bug 51434 in which I reported the same issue. 

Thanks. 
Bill.
colorful software.
